channel.title: math.SP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Low energy resolvent asymptotics of the multipole Aharonov--Bohm Hamiltonian
item.description: arXiv:2408.03233v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We compute low energy asymptotics for the resolvent of the Aharonov--Bohm Hamiltonian with multiple poles for both integer and non-integer total fluxes. For integral total flux we reduce to prior results in black-box scattering while for non-integral total flux we build on the corresponding techniques using an appropriately chosen model resolvent. The resolvent expansion can be used to obtain long-time wave asymptotics for the Aharonov--Bohm Hamiltonian with multiple poles. An interesting phenomenon is that if the total flux is an integer then the scattering resembles even-dimensional Euclidean scattering, while if it is half an odd integer then it resembles odd-dimensional Euclidean scattering. The behavior for other values of total flux thus provides an `interpolation' between these.
item.dc:creator: T. J. Christiansen, K. Datchev, M. Yang
